title: Junior Data Scientist
description: I managed to somehow get myself a software position when I was in my last semester of high school. At the time DLC was led by Mohamed AbdElTawab, my supervisors were Maged Shalaby and Sherif AbdEl Karim. I worked on two big projects when I was there. I started with a visualization dashboard that was used to visualize a large dataset containing numerous properties on platform usage from 60+ countries.

title: Queen's University
company: Bachelor in Mathematics and Computer Engineering
description: After 17 eventful years in Egypt, I got an offer to study at Queen's university in Canada. At the time I was sure I was going to study Aerospace Engineering, but I took a linear algebra class in first year and decided to switch to a joint degree Queen's offers in Mathematics and Computer Engineering.

title: Lead Software Developer
description: I worked on developing a instructional video platform using React and Django.

title: Covid 19 World Project
date: May 2020, My first major side project
description: In March 2019, Covid was beginning to become a problem in Canada and my university had just shut down. I started working on a project to track cases worldwide. It took me a few months to finish it, but I ended up creating a web application that does tracking and created a Python module that does disease spread simulations. By the time I finished in May, there were already tons of trackers out there, but my little website got a few thousand hits to it felt good to inform some people.

title: Software Engineer
description: IBM was my big break into the big tech world as a Software Engineer. It was a great learning experience technically and professionally. I worked on developing software features for the Watson Studio platform under the supervision of Lin Ju and Dejan Glozic. I owned one of their microservices where I overhauled a lot of the backend and worked regularly on fixing bugs and developing feature requests. I was also responsible for doing service integrations from other teams on Watson Studio. During my internship, I integrated 9 new services in Watson Studio. I worked on developing new pages and UI features for Watson Studio's new UI known as Projects 3.0. This included doing a lot front end development for the new UI and I created a reusable data panel module for my team. Additionally, I new foundations for bundle optimization and dependency sharing by adding Webpack 5 to my team's code base, introducing concepts such as code splitting, module fedaration, and treeshaking

title: Founder at Yasa
description: Early 2020 I Co-Founded a company called Yasa
